controlled_vocabulary.comment: This control table is used by the Canonical Sequence Feature table to describe the type of feature that is referred to.

term.name: gene_name
term.description: The DNA is a copy of a gene, which may contain introns and regulatory regions as well as coding sequence

term.name: serial_orf_name
term.description: the DNA is a copy of the coding sequence only but may not have been verified by isolation of a mRNA or protein in model organisms

term.name: genomic
term.description: the DNA is derived from a genomic regions that may have no, one or many features

term.name: crna
term.description: the DNA is a copy of a piece of DNA that normally codes for an RNA final product, such as rRNA , tRNA, hnRNA etc.

term.name: cds
term.description: the DNA is a copy of a transcript that has been isolated as an entity
